summary: Robert W. Genzman was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). The documents available are payroll certifications and reports from 1977 and 1978, indicating that Genzman was on the committee's staff during that period. The specific role or responsibilities of Genzman within the HSCA are not detailed in these documents, but his presence on the payroll signifies his involvement in the committee's operations during its investigation into the JFK assassination.
significance: Robert W. Genzman's significance lies in his employment with the HSCA, contributing to the investigation into the JFK assassination. While his specific role is not detailed in these documents, his presence on the payroll indicates his participation in the committee's work.
